name: The Lion, The Admiral, and a Cat called B. Uma Vijaylakshmi - Book Launch
description:
V. Raghunathan has worn many hats: naval cadet, IIM professor, president of a private sector bank, chief executive of a large private foundation. Along the way, he has been an advisor for a Punjabi gaali competition, calculated the price of a piss and the age of a state bus, built one of the largest collection of padlocks in India, written a host of bestselling titles, and even named a cat.
The Lion, the Admiral and a Cat Called B. Uma Vijaylakshmi is a thrilling account of a career and a life in the changing landscape of India from the 1970s to the present. This book is about viewing each life-situation as an adventure and a lesson, and offers valuable insights into management, resilience and innovative problem-solving. Through it all, Raghunathan’s sharp wit and constantly curious intelligence shines as a beacon of hope and cheer in an often-difficult world.

name: Underground Film Club - Monthly Film Screenings
description:
At a time when we are spoilt for choice on what to watch, the best movies don't make it to streaming. And nothing beats the communal experience of watching a movie together. Join us for the first (literally) Underground film club in the city. 
This month, join us for a screening of Frances Ha (2013). When Frances's friend and room-mate Sophie moves out, Frances is left to fend for herself. Frances experiences new adventures in the city, where she also finds love and makes a decent living.

name: Understanding the Form - Kathak Tradition, Concept & Choreography - Lecture - Demonstration
description:
Join us for a lecture-demonstration on Kathak tradition, concept, and choreography, by Vidushi Saswati Sen. Saswati Sen is an Indian dancer and choreographer, and an exponent of Kathak, an Indian classical dance form. She was a senior disciple of Pandit Birju Maharaj, and still teaches and performs at his Kalashram Institute in the Jor Bagh district of New Delhi. Saswati Sen received a Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2004.
Tickets are priced at Rs. 200 per person and are available at Atta Galatta.

name: Write Your First Story with People's Kafe - Writing Workshop
description:
Write your first Story with People`s Kafe where Amazon Bestselling Author Priyanka Kumar shall guide you through the creative process of channelling your ideas into a captivating story.
Takeaways:
* Pen first draft of a story you`ve always wanted to write
* Understand elements of timeless stories
* Learn tips to create compelling stories
* Overcome any mental blocks with respect to writing process

name: Love at First Byte - Book Launch
description:
Annika is an introverted free-spirited girl stepping on the threshold of adulthood with her first job in a tech agency. She is as rooted as she is a dreamer, with a naïve child-like wonder and innocence about her. As she explores a new world full of acronyms, jargons, and volatile emotions in the vibrant city of Hyderabad, she finds a lighthouse in her friends, Kabir, Kriti, Maggie, & Ved. A chance encounter with Veer, smart and intelligent with an absolutely captivating manner, brings to life her romantic wonderings. In the midst of making a splash in the digital marketing world, will she find her place under the sun on her terms? Join us at Atta Galatta on 30th November at 4.30 PM to find out!
About the author
Divya is a marketer by day (VP of Growth at Super.com, a North American startup) and a writer by night. She has degrees in journalism, psychology, and business administration, which allow her to explore the written word with different lenses and perspectives. Her extensive corporate experience, mostly fun and occasionally challenging, have served as inspiration for her most recent novel, 'Love At First Byte.' Her portfolio includes among others, the suspense thriller 'The Monsoon Touch,' an anthology of youth poetry, a teen detective novel, a romance novel ‘Dreams’ as a series for Young Times (UAE), and a compilation of short stories ‘All in One Heartbeat.’ Her poem ‘Loneliness’ made its way to the American Congress Library

name: Cake Frosting Workshop - Workshop
description: One-of-a-kind Cake-Frosting workshop happening on 30th November, 2024 in one of the scenic, serene places - Atta Galata in Indiranagar. The workshop is a place to get creative in a fun way with lots of vibrant vibes and colors. We at Gobananas_bakes, strive for everyone walk-away with an amicable experience. It is the perfect getaway for people who like to unwind and furthermore learn Frosting to make intriguing cakes. The Event covers step by step concise, lucid instructions with insights to easier, smarter way to Frost a Bento Cake from an experienced Home-Baker who has conducted many similar workshops. All the materials will be provided to frost a cake, including cute toppers to get an ethereal experience. The participants get to know-how of trending piping methods to notch-up the looks of a piped flower or to border a cake. Furthermore, recipe will be provided to get the stable cream which gives Baker’s sleepless nights. Adieu, icing of the event, the participants get to take the cake proudly along with goodies.

name: Acupuncture Healing Energy Bootcamp - Wellness Workshop
description:
Join us for an eye-opening and heart-opening session of healing at Atta Galatta on Saturday, 30th Nov. 6 to 7:30 PM! In this session you will:

Learn about the ancient Chinese system of healing known as Acupuncture
Understand how blocked and imbalanced energies in our bodies could lead to chronic physical and emotional ailments
Get personalized treatment to unblock and balance your energies (no needles involved)
Have an intense guided journalling and meditation session to uncover inner wounds and heal them
Get tips for a more balanced life

Ideal for those who suffer from recurring physical ailments, those who seek to break recurring unhealthy behavioural patterns, those seeking relief from stress and anxiety and for curious souls looking to understand their bodies and minds better.
Participants are requested to wear loose and comfortable clothing as we will be doing some light stretches during the session.
Please bring along a pen and a bottle of water.

name: The Colony Brats - Book Launch
description:
Experience the Exclusive Launch of The Colony Brats, a Coming-of-Age Comedy-Drama by Vineed P Menon!
Hi, I’m Niv, though my parents named me Nivrutti Nandan Nedumpilly Nair—yeah, I know, what a ridiculous name. But trust me, the name is nothing compared to the ridiculousness of my life. And here’s why we call ourselves brats in Sawalpur, a town dominated by the cement plant:

As children of wage board workers, we faced injustice and weren’t allowed to enter the officers’ colony. But I had the guts to sneak into my girlfriend’s quarters—don’t ask why.
My best friend, Baiju, had the audacity to have an affair—sorry, a relationship—with the colony’s schoolteacher.
Our so-called ordinary life was filled with mischief, adventures, and escapades.
Our shift to an ultra-ordinary life came with reckless schemes and acts of revenge, making the lives of the factory officers, who took their privilege a bit too literally, a living hell—just to prove our worth.
My problem? I take things to heart and always make sure to get back at those who hurt me. This time, it was the cement company that wronged me, and I made sure to give back royally.

Read The Colony Brats to learn how not to screw up your life—and everyone else's—with vengeance. Get ready to laugh, cry, and rethink everything as you follow our journey from innocent kids to not-so-innocent troublemaking adults. Outrage can turn your world upside down, and our story is living proof of that.
The Invite
Hey there! Niv here. Curious about me, my best friend Baiju, and the chaotic world of our cement colony in Sawalpur? Join us at Atta Galatta on 30th November at 6:30 pm. Trust me—you won’t want to miss the laughs, the drama, and all the mayhem in between.
And here’s the kicker: you’ll meet the mastermind behind all this—our storyteller and certified troublemaker, Vineed P. Menon! He’s more than just a writer, let me tell you. He’s written and directed over eight original plays, including That Night and Family Ke Side Effects, along with short films like First Sin, Interfere, and Ring Road that even made the Dadasaheb Phalke Awards take notice. Oh, and he’s also the co-writer of the Assamese film Birangana Xaadhani (currently in post-production). And if that’s not enough, he’s also a seasoned Training Manager—though I’ve got a few “training” stories of my own he wouldn’t dare share!
So, whether you're here for the stories, the laughs, or just to see what kind of madness unfolds, be there. You won’t regret it—well, at least not as much as the cement company regrets messing with me!

name: Design Thinking - Workshop
description:
Design Thinking is a human-centred approach to problem solving applied by top corporations, entrepreneurs and leaders from all spheres.
In this workshop, you`ll learn:
The five-step design thinking process: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, and Test.
How to apply design thinking to real-world challenges.
Practical tools and techniques for brainstorming and problem-solving.
Join us and discover how design thinking can help you:
- Innovate more effectively.
- Collaborate with others.
- Create solutions that truly meet the needs of users.
- Don`t miss this opportunity to ignite your creativity and drive innovation.
Brought to you by Primate Advisory (Design Thinking consulting and training firm)

name: Unashamed - Meet and Greet
description:
Dive into a transformative journey with Neha Bhat, the insightful mind behind @indiansextherapist on Instagram, as she fearlessly tackles the intricacies of sex, sexuality, trauma and shame in her groundbreaking book, Unashamed.
In a society that often hushes discussions on the most fundamental aspects of human existence, Neha invites readers to explore the uncharted territories of their own desires. With a unique blend of empathy, humor, reflection and unwavering expertise, she dismantles the stigma surrounding sexuality, in turn, asking readers to embrace the full spectrum of their desires without reservation.
Unashamed delves deep into the psychological landscape of shame, unravelling the roots that bind individuals and communities to outdated norms. Through engaging anecdotes, relatable case studies, and her own experiences as a sex therapist, Neha provides a roadmap for individuals seeking to understand, accept, and celebrate their unique sexual identities. Exercises, quizzes, and journalling prompts in the book gives readers practical tools to break free from the shackles of shame and embark on a liberating journey towards self-discovery.
Join us at Atta Galatta to meet the author of this path-breaking book, on 1st December at 2 PM!

name: Support Group - Support Group
description:
Topic: A discussion on chapter 1 & 2 from the book "Attached"; Decoding relationship behavior, Dependency is not a bad word.
The book "Attached” will be available at the bookstore for purchase.
People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every wake of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.
This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.
The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore.This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Sip Coffee & Stroke - Art Workshop for Women
description:
Good things happen when women connect.
Looking for a fun way to spending your Sunday with a warm cup of coffee and connect?
Come join us to paint on canvas - Timeless beauty and tranquillity of the Sunset
Take away:
Painting to add vibrancy to your room or your living.  An ideal gift that you can make, gift and surprise anyone.
This is a wonderful opportunity to receive encouragement from peer women.
What to Bring:
No prior art experience is necessary! Participants should an open mind. All other materials will be provided.
Registration:
Spaces are limited, so early registration is encouraged. For women only!

name: All-In: The Moments - Improv Comedy Show
description:
9 improvisers take over the stage without any script. A few prompts from the audience are all that they want. Can they make things funny? Can they even come up with a story? They have 1.5 hours to prove.
What is improv?
Improv is not a play, there’s no script. It is also not standup, there are no tried and tested jokes. It is somewhere in between these two things. You’ll have to come to find out!
Why should you attend?

You are part of the script - your prompts will decide where the show will go
You can bring a date for a cool show
You can tell your Instagram friends that you attended a cool show
